top_note:
[RESTORATION SCOPE]
1) INTERIOR RESTORATION 
Water damage repair, structural framing, drywall/flooring replacement, interior finishes
2) COMPLETE SIDING REPLACEMENT 
Remove existing siding, install weather barrier, premium vinyl siding (2,510.6 sq ft)
3) PARTIAL ROOF REPLACEMENT
Repair roof deck punctures (Facets C & D), reconstruct eave structure, complete roofing

[BUILDING CODE ADHERENCE]
Virginia 2021 USBC: Enhanced requirements for tornado-prone designation areas
International Residential Code (IRC): Structural and envelope restoration standards
OSHA 29 CFR 1926.451: Safety compliance for multi-story restoration work
ASTM Standards: Material specifications and installation practices

[OVERHEAD & PROFIT]
Industry Standard Application: 20% O&P reflects standard DMV market rates for restoration projects involving multiple specialized trades.
Overhead (10%): Project management, insurance/bonding, equipment, administrative costs, warranty provisions
Profit (10%): Market-rate contractor profit, business risk assumption, investment return, quality incentive

Multi-Trade:
- Complex project coordination between interior restoration, complete siding replacement, and partial roof reconstruction
- Structural repairs involving roof deck punctures and eave damage from tree impact
- Building code compliance across multiple disciplines (2021 USBC, IRC requirements)
- Quality assurance for structural integrity and weather envelope restoration
- Risk management for coordinated exterior work (siding and roofing) and interior finishes
bottom_note:
Scope & Exclusions: 
This estimate covers only the work detailed herein. Any additional structural damages or code-required upgrades discovered after the removal of existing materials will be documented and submitted as a supplemental estimate for approval.


Roofing Estimate:
This proposal details the estimated costs to perform a partial roof replacement on the rear slopes (identified as Facets C and D in the EagleView report ) of the property listed above. The damage is a direct result of a fallen tree, which caused multiple punctures in the roof deck and significant damage to the eave structure.

All specified materials and installation methods are based on the requirements of the International Residential Code (IRC) and applicable local building codes to ensure a safe and durable restoration of the property.

Code Compliance: All work shall be performed in a professional manner and in compliance with all applicable local and state building codes, as well as the material manufacturer's installation specifications. This estimate includes costs for all code-required components for a new roofing system.
 • IRC R803.2.3: Deck re-nailing        
 • IRC R905: Underlayment requirements   
 • IRC R806.2: Ventilation standards     
 • OSHA 1926.501: Fall protection        
 • IRC R903.2: Flashing specifications

items.name: Surface Protection during Construction
items.dec: Protects adjacent finished surfaces from damage during construction activities as per OSHA standards.

items.name: Plastic Sheeting/Dust Barriers
items.dec: Erecting dust barriers in occupied spaces to contain debris and dust during construction, in accordance with industry best practices.

items.name: Floor Protection (Ram board/cardboard)
items.dec: Protecting finished floor areas in adjacent spaces from damage due to foot traffic and material transport during construction.

items.name: Door Casing Undercut (for flooring work)
items.dec: Required for proper installation of new flooring. IRC R502.3 requires proper subfloor preparation and transitions between different floor materials.

items.name: Transition Strip Installation
items.dec: Required between rooms with different flooring materials. IRC R502.3 requires proper subfloor preparation and transitions between different floor materials.

items.name: Subfloor Inspection
items.dec: Per IRC R502.3, required for proper subfloor preparation before new flooring installation.

items.name: Room-Specific Cleanup
items.dec: Daily cleanup within the work area to maintain a safe and efficient job site.

items.name: Remove Baseboard
items.dec: Removal of undamaged baseboard not removed during water mitigation

items.name: Remove Crown Molding
items.dec: Removal of undamaged crown molding not removed during water mitigation

items.name: Carpet Installation
items.dec: Installation of new carpet and pad to match existing type and quality per LKQ standards. IRC R503.1 requires proper subfloor preparation.

items.name: Acoustic Ceiling Tile (2 layers)
items.dec: Replacement of ceiling tile to match existing per LKQ standards.

items.name: 1/2" Drywall Installation (3 layers, on wall)
items.dec: Installation of new drywall where existing was removed due to water damage. IRC R702.3 requires proper installation per manufacturer specifications.

items.name: Drywall Tape and Blend (on wall)
items.dec: Taping and blending of new drywall joints. IRC R702.3.8 mandates joint treatment with minimum three coats of joint compound.

items.name: Drywall Repair for Trim Detach/Reset (Walls)
items.dec: Repair of drywall surfaces where trim was detached and reset.

items.name: Blown-in insulation - 10" depth - R26 (Ceiling)
items.dec: Replacement of ceiling insulation due to water damage. IRC R402 mandates minimum insulation requirements by climate zone.

items.name: Batt insulation 10" R30 unfaced batt (Walls)
items.dec: Replacement of wall insulation only in areas where wet insulation was removed during water mitigation. IRC R402 mandates minimum insulation requirements by climate zone.

items.name: Paneling & Wood Wall Finishes
items.dec: Replacement of wood paneling to match existing style and quality per LKQ standards.

items.name: Prime Walls
items.dec: Required for proper paint adhesion on new drywall and wood surfaces. IRC R702.3.8 requires proper surface preparation with PVA primer for proper paint adhesion.

items.name: Paint Walls (2 Coats)
items.dec: Painting walls to match existing color and sheen per LKQ standards.

items.name: Baseboard Replacement (7"+ Tall)
items.dec: Water-damaged baseboard requires complete replacement to match existing height and profile. IRC R702.5 mandates continuous trim installation.

items.name: Quarter Round Replacement
items.dec: Replacement of quarter round to match existing. IRC R702.5 mandates continuous trim installation.

items.name: Prime Baseboard and Quarter Round (Stained Wood)
items.dec: Required for proper stain adhesion on new trim. IRC R702.3.8 requires proper surface preparation.

items.name: Crown Molding Replacement (Standard Wood)
items.dec: Water-damaged crown molding requires complete replacement to match existing. IRC R702.5 mandates continuous trim installation.

items.name: Prime Crown Molding (Stained Wood)
items.dec: Required for proper stain adhesion on new trim. IRC R702.3.8 requires proper surface preparation.

items.name: Stain & Finish Crown Molding (2 coats)
items.dec: Staining and finishing new crown molding to match existing.

items.name: Beam Inspection and Repair (Exposed Beam near Skylight)
items.dec: Inspection and necessary repair of exposed beams due to potential impact from falling tree branch. IRC R502.1 requires structural integrity for framing.

items.name: Wood Trim at Drywall/Wood Wall Boundary
items.dec: Replacement of wood trim at the boundary between drywall and wood paneling to match existing.
